intro: Matelea lehmannii, commonly known as the Lehmann's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Matelea lehmannii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
